1.text: I am the man that hath seen affliction By the rod of His wrath.

2.text: He hath led me and caused me to walk in darkness and not in light.

3.text: Surely against me He turneth His hand again and again all the day.

4.text: My flesh and my skin hath He worn out; He hath broken my bones.

5.text: He hath builded against me, and compassed me With gall and travail.

6.text: He hath made me to dwell in dark places, As those that have been long dead.

7.text: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot go forth; He hath made my chain heavy.

8.text: Yea, when I cry and call for help, He shutteth out my prayer.

9.text: He hath enclosed my ways with hewn stone, He hath made my paths crooked.

10.text: He is unto me as a bear lying in wait, As a lion in secret places.

11.text: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces; He hath made me desolate.

12.text: He hath bent His bow, and set me As a mark for the arrow.

13.text: He hath caused the arrows of His quiver To enter into my reins.

14.text: I am become a derision to all my people, And their song all the day.

15.text: He hath filled me with bitterness, He hath sated me with wormwood.

16.text: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, He hath made me to wallow in ashes.

17.text: And my soul is removed far off from peace, I forgot prosperity.

18.text: And I said: ‘My strength is perished, And mine expectation from the LORD.’

19.text: Remember mine affliction and mine anguish, The wormwood and the gall.

20.text: My soul hath them still in remembrance, And is bowed down within me.

21.text: This I recall to my mind, Therefore have I hope.

22.text: Surely the LORD’S mercies are not consumed, Surely His compassions fail not.

23.text: They are new every morning; Great is Thy faithfulness.

24.text: The LORD is my portion’, saith my soul; ‘Therefore will I hope in Him.’

25.text: The LORD is good unto them that wait for Him, To the soul that seeketh Him.

26.text: It is good that a man should quietly wait For the salvation of the LORD.

27.text: It is good for a man that he bear The yoke in his youth.

28.text: Let him sit alone and keep silence, Because He hath laid it upon him.

29.text: Let him put his mouth in the dust, If so be there may be hope.

30.text: Let him give his cheek to him that smiteth him Let him be filled full with reproach.

31.text: For the Lord will not cast off For ever.

32.text: For though He cause grief, yet will He have compassion According to the multitude of His mercies.

33.text: For He doth not afflict willingly, Nor grieve the children of men.

34.text: To crush under foot All the prisoners of the earth,

35.text: To turn aside the right of a man Before the face of the Most High,

36.text: To subvert a man in his cause, The Lord approveth not.

37.text: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, When the Lord commandeth it not?

38.text: Out of the mouth of the Most High proceedeth not Evil and good?

39.text: Wherefore doth a living man complain, A strong man because of his sins?

40.text: Let us search and try our ways, And return to the LORD.

41.text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands Unto God in the heavens.

42.text: We have transgressed and have rebelled; Thou hast not pardoned.

43.text: Thou hast covered with anger and pursued us; Thou hast slain unsparingly.

44.text: Thou hast covered Thyself with a cloud, So that no prayer can pass through.

45.text: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse In the midst of the peoples.

46.text: All our enemies have opened their mouth Wide against us.

47.text: Terror and the pit are come upon us, Desolation and destruction.

48.text: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water, For the breach of the daughter of my people.

49.text: Mine eye is poured out, and ceaseth not, Without any intermission,

50.text: Till the LORD look forth, And behold from heaven.

51.text: Mine eye affected my soul, Because of all the daughters of my city.

52.text: They have chased me sore like a bird, That are mine enemies without cause.

53.text: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, And have cast stones upon me.

54.text: Waters flowed over my head; I said: ‘I am cut off.’

55.text: I called upon Thy name, O LORD, Out of the lowest dungeon.

56.text: Thou heardest my voice; hide not Thine ear at my sighing, at my cry.

57.text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon Thee; Thou saidst: ‘Fear not.’

58.text: O Lord, Thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; Thou hast redeemed my life.

59.text: O LORD, Thou hast seen my wrong; Judge Thou my cause.

60.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance And all their devices against me.

61.text: Thou hast heard their taunt, O LORD, And all their devices against me;

62.text: The lips of those that rose up against me, And their muttering against me all the day.

63.text: Behold Thou their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their song.

64.text: Thou wilt render unto them a recompense, O LORD, According to the work of their hands.

65.text: Thou wilt give them hardness of heart, Thy curse unto them.

66.text: Thou wilt pursue them in anger, and destroy them From under the heavens of the LORD.
